alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 05 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Excessive runoff will continue to cause some flooding problems due to very heavy rainfall that occurred overnight. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following counties, Butler, Harvey and Sedgwick. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported high water impacting a few roads in northeast Sedgwick county this morning. Flooding is ongoing due to very heavy that occurred overnight. Trained weather spotters in the warned area reported 3 to 5 inch rainfall totals from late last night into this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wichita, El Dorado, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Towanda, Benton, Whitewater, Kechi, Potwin and Elbing.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
